message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I understand you're interested in the product, but $120 is a bit low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer it to you for $135.
I'm still interested in the product, but I think $135 is a bit too high. I'd be willing to pay $125 for it. Can you meet me at that price?

I'm not willing to go as low as $125, but I'm willing to make a compromise. I'll offer it to you for $140. This is my final offer, but I'm willing to negotiate further if you're willing to meet me halfway.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'd be willing to pay $130 for the product. Can you consider that?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the minimum price I'm willing to accept, but I'm still willing to negotiate. I'll offer it to you for $145. This is my last offer before I start to get concerned that we're not going to come to an agreement.
I understand you're getting concerned, but I'm still interested in the product. I'd be willing to pay $137.50 for it. Is that a price you'd be willing to accept?

I'm still not willing to go below $145, but I'm willing to make a slight concession. I'll offer it to you for $142.50. This is my final offer, and if you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm willing to pay $135 for the product. This is my final offer. If you're not willing to accept it, I'll have to consider buying from John for $100.
